intro: Grammica cesatiana, commonly known as the velvetleaf, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves that are often covered in a fine, velvety texture. The plant produces showy, yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, attracting various pollinators. It is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions. Due to its rapid growth, it is sometimes considered an invasive species in certain regions.
